course.title: American Health Care Policy
course.meeting_text: M., W., 3:30-5, and a weekly section to be arranged
course.description: Health care in America poses fundamental policy challenges to our ability to protect low income Americans from the costs of illness; to produce high quality care; to efficiently use health care resources, and to allow Americans to die without pain, in the company of family, as they desire. This course aims to offer students a solid understanding of the American health care system, the potential impact of new reform legislation, and challenges that will remain in the future.
course.notes: Students who have taken General Education 186 or Extra-Departmental Courses 186 may not take this course for credit.
